sentences.en: At times he talked to himself, and stammered lugubrious monologues in a low voice.
sentences.cn: 有时,他自言自语, 吞吞吐吐,低声说着一些凄惨的话.

sentences.en: He had a long lugubrious face with drooping and soft pouches beneath the eyes.
sentences.cn: 他低垂着头,一张忧郁的脸拉得老长,眼睛下垂着松弛的眼袋.

sentences.en: He had a long lugubrious face with drooping jowls and soft pouches beneath the eyes.
sentences.cn: 他有着阴沉的长脸,下垂的下颚,眼睛下面的眼袋松泡泡的.

sentences.en: He plays some passages so slowly that they become lugubrious.
sentences.cn: 有些段落他演奏得异常徐缓，听上去有些忧伤。
他那张忧伤、泪痕斑斑的脸

sentences.en: That long, lugubrious howl rose on the night air again!
sentences.cn: 夜空中又传来了那又长又凄凉的狗叫声.

sentences.en: These things are charming when one is joyous, and lugubrious when one is sad.
sentences.cn: 那些东西,在快乐的人听来非常悦耳,但伤心人却感到无限苍凉.

sentences.en: This ingredient does not invite or generally produce lugubrious lamentation.
sentences.cn: 这一要素并不引起,或者说通常不产生故作悲伤的叹息.

sentences.en: Why are you looking so lugubrious?
sentences.cn: 你怎麽看上去这样忧郁?

trans.tran_cn: 悲哀的，阴郁的，令人伤心的，令人灰心的
trans.tran_en: very sad and serious – sometimes used humorously
